sources.data_found: Caltech has a first centrally managed high performance computing cluster supported by the Resnick Sustainability Institute.
GPU Nodes table lists: Nvidia P100 (50 nodes), V100 (2 nodes), H100 (4 nodes), L40s (4 nodes), H200 (18 nodes).
Common Data Set 2024-2025 containing total enrollment data.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate count (268) sourced from Gemini findings referencing Registrar data. Graduate CS count (120) and PhD count (80) are estimates derived by Claude based on total engineering enrollment figures, as specific department breakdowns were not explicitly detailed in the Common Data Set. Gemini found 88 total graduate students but Claude's estimate is higher, so it is used per aggregation rules.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Mentioned in CMS department cluster docs.

gpu_resources.notes: Counts are aggregated from multiple clusters. The Resnick HPC Center (OpenAI source) lists 72 H200s (18 nodes x 4), 16 H100s (4 nodes x 4), 16 L40s, 8 V100s, and 200 P100s. Gemini identified a larger pool of V100s (112 total: 104 from HPC3 + 8 from CAST) and 56 A100s (40GB) from facility descriptions. The highest non-zero values from all sources are used.

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI, Claude, and Gemini models. OpenAI provided the most up-to-date hardware list for the Resnick HPC (including H200s), while Gemini identified older/alternative clusters (HPC3) with significant V100/A100 capacity. Student data combines specific findings with estimates due to the lack of a public granular breakdown for Fall 2024.
validation_notes: No changes made. All GPU resources appear to be locally owned by Caltech. Student data is present and does not require modification.
